area_name: Laconia / Meredith Scraggly Granite Crack Wall (Needs some work)

content.description:
This spot needs some work...it's only ~25 feet off the road to the wall (down into the ravine / spillway), and there is a 5-10 foot wide section to approach the wall.  You'll see the first ledge to step onto (literally, a step). 

  From here, lots of slab work up, and don't use the gigantic horizontal crack.
content.location:
Right off of 3 (Daniel Webster) (intersection of Neal Shore and Daniel Webster) in Laconia. 

  park right on neal shore, walk across Danile Webster and you'll see the way down into the ravine (I cleared the path a little).   

  you'll see the face in front of you.  Throw the pad down, and step up.

pathTokens: Laconia / Meredith Scraggly Granite Crack Wall (Needs some work)

content.description:
This Ravine with an outcropping of Granite is directly at the intersection of Neals Shore Rd and Daniel Webster Hway (3), in Laconia.    

  The approach (maybe 15 feet) has NOT been cleared out yet.  I cleared a little bit to get an approach to the wall, which allows one access to a slabby crimpy approach.   This spot could use some clearing to do some traverse work.   

  Right now, there is one ok spot to climb, but there looks like some possibility to the right of the spot. 

  The rock is granite, but be careful, some of the rocks are loose/holds might crumble on you.
